subject: Business
title: Push vs. Pull Supply Chains
description: Learn Push vs. Pull Supply Chains in one minute.

hook.text: A supermarket stocks 50,000 items hoping you'll buy some. That's push. Toyota builds a car only after you order it.

buildup.text: Push systems produce based on forecasts. Pull systems produce based on actual demand.

discovery.text: Push risks overproduction and waste. Pull risks delays and stockouts if production can't keep up.

twist.text: Most real supply chains are hybrid: push for stable items, pull for customizable or volatile ones.

climax.text: Dell revolutionized PCs with a pull model: build-to-order eliminated billions in unsold inventory.

punchline.text: Push guesses what you'll want. Pull waits until you tell it.

quiz.question: What is the key difference between push and pull supply chains?
options: Push produces based on forecasts; pull produces based on actual demand
Push is faster; pull is cheaper
Push uses trucks; pull uses ships
